page.title: 11FINCHCOCKS
page.content: Finchcocks was built for Edward Bathurst, whose family lived there for most of the 18th century, in 1725 and is noted for its outstanding brickwork. It is in parkland surrounded by hopgardens. When the Legat School of Ballet moved to Mark Cross, in 1970, Richard Burnett, a pianist, specialising in Fortepiano playing, bought it. It now houses his remarkable collection of historical keyboard instruments most of which are in playing condition. Finchcocks is now a musical centre of international repute and many activities take place there like concerts, open days, musical tours and other events. The gardens are being restored and will also be opened to the public.
